This is free. Because of that, the question becomes, "is it worth your time"?

Des particules, on les attire lorsqu'on ne fait rien, on les repousse quand on appuie sur la gachette, et on peut régler l'intensité de l'attraction/répulsion avec le trackpad et les disséminer en remuant plus ou moins fort les manettes... C'est tout simple mais en jouant sur les différence d'intensité et en rapprochant plus ou moins les manettes, on finit par créer tout un tas d'effets différents.

31352619.review:
So I have been playing VR for a little over a month now on my oculus rift.  Everytime I view a new game or experience I feel like I'm part of some large experiment.  The way we use VR and the way VR is evolving is beyond anything I could have imagined and I have a hard time explaining it to anyone who hasn't experienced it yet.  I often feel like I'm one VR experience away from a total mental breakdown however and I'm starting to question what the long term effects on the human brain will actually be.

I've experienced Cosmic Sugar for maybe 30 minutes and I am totally convinced that I would probably pay 800 dollars just to know that I can do that anytime I want.  I can't wait to tell all my friends that I can show them what its like to be God.  

I am so very very excited about the future of VR but I am also so very very afraid.  The future is far weirder and way more insane that anyone could have ever predicted.  Donald Trump is president and I can manipulate particles with my hands.  I love it.

29409005.review: It's all about gravity and it's great! I'm not sure whether this experience is for everybody, but with this simulation you can experience first hand what your teachers told you about gravity and the universe in general. As a suggestion: start with only one controller (position the other outside you playfield) and experience what you can do and what happens if a lot of mass gathers in a single point and then gyrate it around or pull the trigger! And remember: you are in VR so you can walk around and look at your experiment from different angles!

Give this application a chance: spend some time experimenting with the controls and allow the process of discovery to work its magic on you; stream music to fit your mood; melt the cosmic sugar all over your soul.

28144730.review: nothing too spectacular but the underlying physics are really something to behold. the persistent particles and the colours are nice to look at.

28133167.review:
I had to force myself to stop playing this game in order to write this review. Hard to believe that something this simple could also be so beautiful. The perfect VR experience to simply relax to. No points, no score, no guns, no enemies. This game is best experienced either standing or sitting, but ideally with some relaxing music playing. This is basically a mesmerizing iTunes visualizer (you remember the good ones? From the early 2000's.) that you get to control. So, to make this a proper review, the good:

1. This is pretty unique
2. It is exceedingly simple in design, but still elegant.
3. It is easy to get lost in this game just playing with the physics.
4. It runs surprisingly well given the CPU intensive nature of the physics.

So the bad (not really bad, just niggles.):

1. There are no options as far as setting. It's a blank dark expanse you stand in. Dev please add some choices for backgrounds. A beach at night, the surface of the moon, etc.

2. No music either. There's plenty of open source chillstep music that would go perfect for this game.

3. Minor performance dips, i'm running an FX-8350 @ 4.2 ghz and a R9-290X and sometimes would see gameplay slow, especially when the particles star clumping tightly. To the Dev's credit, framerates appear to stay solid, but the game time slows to compensate.

For free this is an absolute must have for anyone with a Vive headset.

28131429.review: Absolutely download this. 100 percent must-have for Vive.

28114911.review:
その名のとおりです、砂糖を無重力空間上にばらまくアプリです。
とても綺麗かつリアルで、気が付いたら1時間以上遊んでました。
好きな音楽でもかけながら遊ぶとより楽しく遊べます。
やることいっぱいあるゲームにつかれた人にオススメ。

28111437.review: I wondered if anything was going to steal my time like Google Earth VR, but THIS HAS DONE IT. After 2 days of guessing my way through how the controls worked and what was actually going on, it finally CLICKED, and I just can't stop. I feed my ears with some ambient music and and I just start building sculptures with light. This is a much different experience than something like Tilt Brush, once you gain and understanding of the controls when you don't really "think about it" anymore. It gets really surreal in there, and it's just amazing. I'd LOVE to see more colors, but I'm a raving fan.

28091624.review: This is an amazing tech demo if nothing else.  I love it.  I only wish it had a customizable amount of particles.

28086895.review: pretty particles....I think ill just stay here a while longer....like bake off with caster sugar everywhere!

28086723.review: Simple yet amazing experience. After a few minutes I felt a god-like control over the universe. And free?!? More please!

28082631.review:
Pls get this game if you have Vive!!! Nothing has made me more excited and relaxed in the same few seconds as Cosmic Sugar!!! Highly, Highly, Highly recomend this game. 

Could use a bit more customization ingame but Wooooow i Love this game.

28082277.review: This is a must-try for VR. It's an incredibly simple yet remarkably powerful experience.

28080433.review:
The pictures here just don't do it justice. Seeing it on the Vive was amazing and definitely an experience everyone should try, especially given that it's free!

Honestly, there's no reason not to try this. I spent a good bit of time sitting there, with Daft Punk playing and just.. enjoyed it. One of my favorite free VR experiences so far!

28032036.review: I can only describe this as a "God in training" simulator. Download this immediatly

28022485.review: This may very well replace "The Lab" as the very first experience I will use to demo the Vive to friends and family in the future.  Totally intuitive physics and controls.  I am so blown away right now, thank you, thank you, thank you for the astonishing value of this experience!

28009686.review: Amazing excperience. A lot more in depth then what meets the eye. Spent two hours on it last night.

28007300.review:
A essayer absolument!

On se croirait dans un plugin winamp mais que l'on controle avec les controlleurs!
Chaque controlleur dirige un "point de gravité" qui peut repousser ou attirer en fonction de la gachette, et le trackpad permet d'ajuster la force , faible vers la gauche, fort vers la droite.

Avec une musique un peu trippante, c'est le delire, on se prend pour un x-men qui controle ces particules :-)

Il faut experimenter un peu pour vraiment s'amuser, mais en 5 min c'est déja le delire :-)

27925913.review:
Oh wow.  This is absolutely amazing - easily the best $0 I've ever spent!
Actually, I'd be quite happy to spend some $$ on this, it is just so dang beautiful.  Thanks to the dev for a very, very cool experience.

27918344.review: bez watpienia VR to jest przyszlosc, coraz wiecej gier i coraz bardziej sa one przewspaniale, tak jak ta gra, jesli macie gogle to polecam odpalic, zwlaszcza, ze darmowa!

27915972.review:
have a few drinks, a little smoke, put on your favorite music, and play with some cosmic sugar.
i want more

27900782.review: Absolutely great game. Simple but beautiful. Easy to play but endless possibilities. It feels like you are god, creating new universe. The best smallest game I have been playing...ever!

27900065.review: One of my favourite things in VR!  It's like a micro universe, in which you can play with gravity and shape the evolution of countless tiny galaxies.

27895713.review: Very fun experience. Makes you feel like you are creating a universe. It could use some polish, for example audio.  Considering it is free, it is great fun. Something you would show off to friends while demoing VR.

27893949.review: Incredible!!! Really... this is free???!!!  Stuff  like this validates the expense of VR, thank you!

27893389.review: Simple and amazing, turn on some music and spend a fun 30 minutes playing with particles!

27888976.review: Echt schön. Gut, um Leuten VR zu zeigen.

27864043.review:
Ich habe ein Let's Play in meinem [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3ok91FKp_SAtxhz63Ti3KQ]YouTube-Kanal[/url] aufgenommen:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nJjdZA9obW4

Eine nette VR Erfahrung, vor allem für VR Anfänger und auch für Kinder.
Man erzeugt Anziehungskraft mit den Vive Controllern und kann dann mit dem "Weltraum-Nebel" spielen.
Dies sieht cool aus und funktioniert problemlos und ruckelfrei. Da es kostenlos ist, kann ich es empfehlen. Das einzige was mich ziemlich stört: Es hat absolut keinen Sound.

[u]Positive Merkmale:[/u]
[list]
    	[*] VR Erfahrung für Anfänger und Kinder
    	[*] Steuerung mit den Vive Controllern tadellos
	[*] Hübsche Effekte
	[*] Super funktionierende Physik-Engine
	[*] Kostenlos
[/list]

[u]Negative Merkmale:[/u]
[list]
	[*] Absolut keine Musik oder Soundeffekte
[/list]

39497740.review: An incredibly fun, beautiful, trippy toy to play with.  Listen to music while you play and be mesmerized.

39503774.review: This game is very beautiful and calming. The controls are very simple and the visuals are... like being in the night sky with nothing but colors.
